q: Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.
h:
“Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.” —
Unknown

q: Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.
h:
“Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it.
h:
“Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it. ” —
Confucius

q: The best dreams happen when you're awake.
h:
“The best dreams happen when you're awake.” —
Cherie Gilderbloom

q: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
h:
“The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: A diamond is a piece of charcoal that handled stress exceptionally well.
h:
“A diamond is a piece of charcoal that handled stress exceptionally well.” —
Unknown

q: The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.
h:
“The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Observe things as they are and don't pay attention to other people.
h:
“Observe things as they are and don't pay attention to other people.” —
Huang Po

q: The best mind-altering drug is the truth.
h:
“The best mind-altering drug is the truth.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Wrong turns are as important as right turns. More important, sometimes.
h:
“Wrong turns are as important as right turns. More important, sometimes.” —
Richard Bach

q: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
h:
“You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.” —
James Allen

q: Success is a poor teacher.
h:
“Success is a poor teacher.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
h:
“A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The sweetest pleasure arises from difficulties overcome.
h:
“The sweetest pleasure arises from difficulties overcome.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: If you see a get rich quick scheme, that's someone else trying to get rich off of you.
h:
“If you see a get rich quick scheme, that's someone else trying to get rich off of you.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.
h:
“Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell.
h:
“No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell.” —
Carl Jung

q: Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.
h:
“Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.” —
Dan Brown

q: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
h:
“What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: We are willing to believe anything other than the truth.
h:
“We are willing to believe anything other than the truth.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
h:
“One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.” —
George Eliot

q: To raise your consciousness, surround yourself with people of higher consciousness.
h:
“To raise your consciousness, surround yourself with people of higher consciousness.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.
h:
“Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.” —
Sydney Smith

q: You'll see it when you believe it.
h:
“You'll see it when you believe it. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.
h:
“When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
h:
“It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.” —
Aristotle

q: Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.
h:
“Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.” —
John Tukey

q: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
h:
“Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.” —
Robert Collier

q: The opportunity of defeating the enemy is provided by the enemy himself.
h:
“The opportunity of defeating the enemy is provided by the enemy himself.” —
Sun Tzu

q: It doesn't matter how much you want. What really matters is how much you want it.
h:
“It doesn't matter how much you want. What really matters is how much you want it.” —
Ralph Marston

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:
“The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful.
h:
“Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: Learn to sit back and observe, not everything needs a reaction.
h:
“Learn to sit back and observe, not everything needs a reaction.” —
Unknown

q: You are now, and you do become, what you think about.
h:
“You are now, and you do become, what you think about.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.
h:
“I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.” —
Euripides

q: We are like islands in the sea, separate on the surface but connected in the deep.
h:
“We are like islands in the sea, separate on the surface but connected in the deep.” —
William James

q: In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.
h:
“In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: When you stop questioning, you stop learning.
h:
“When you stop questioning, you stop learning.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.
h:
“To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Do something worth remembering.
h:
“Do something worth remembering.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
h:
“Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Hope is a waking dream.
h:
“Hope is a waking dream.” —
Aristotle

q: Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.
h:
“Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.” —
Unknown

q: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
h:
“Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.” —
Carl Jung

q: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
h:
“One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.” —
Euripides

q: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
h:
“Do every act of your life as if it were your last.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
h:
“Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: What gets measured gets improved.
h:
“What gets measured gets improved.” —
Robin Sharma
